title: New Type Classification -- Crunchy!
content:
By sheer accident while researching for an article I came accross a free font download from General Mills... Alpha-Bits font!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050536im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Alpha-bitsTypophile.png)

So if any of you need a tasty new font for FREE, [**here ’tis**](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050536/http:/www.thinkalphabits.com/alphafont.html).

They even have an Alpha-Bits font EULA :-)

Plus they try to educate cereal munching kids about the [orgins of LETTERS](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050536/http:/typophile.com/wiki/orgins%252Bof%252BLETTERS)!

**Who Invented Letters?**  
Writing hasn’t been around for very long, relatively speaking of course. It was invented much later than drawing and building, but it’s just as important.
 [‹ Printing issues with DTL fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050536/http:/typophile.com/node/17588 "Go to previous forum topic") [[link]: I thought you typophiles would be interested ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050536/http:/typophile.com/node/17594 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Norbert Florendo

comments.content:
I should have spelled:

“TYPOPHILES KERN ALPHA-BITS”

as that is how _passionate_ we feel about type! :-)

C’mon Norbert, where are the small caps? Stuck in the soup stock :-)

ChrisL
forget the smallcaps! where are the marshmallows???

What I was actually looking for was an article in _Money_ that stated General Mills was having problems creating a _healthier_ alternative to sugar laden Alpha-Bits by trying whole oats.

The problem was the shapes would not hold well creating lumpy serifs! LOL!  
I wanted to find the actual article to post.

Well, Paul, at least we could add their definition of _Origin of Letters_ to the Typowiki.

As long as they don’t make a Cerial Bouma Killer :-)

ChrisL

LOL! you guys are cracking me up. my fiancée thinks i’m crazy for spending so much time on here but i can’t help it! thanks!
